title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:44 <sburjan`> has quit  
00:44 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
00:53 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:54 <sburjan`> has quit  
00:54 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
01:39 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:39 <sburjan`> has quit  
01:39 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
01:51 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:52 <sburjan`> has quit  
01:52 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
01:52 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: I'm not sure removing search.js is good  
01:52 <@sdumitriu> Users often upgrade the platform without upgrading the wiki  
01:52 <+jvelociter> hmm true  
01:52 <@sdumitriu> So they'll end up with the "defaultText" class but without the js to make it behave  
01:52 <+jvelociter> I can put it back in compatibility.js  
01:52 <@sdumitriu> Also, there's the this.select() call that's not covered by withTip  
01:52 <+jvelociter> what is that for ?  
01:52 <@sdumitriu> Selecting the search text when clicking in the input field :)  
01:52 <@sdumitriu> None of that is that critical  
01:52 <+jvelociter> ha  
01:52 <@sdumitriu> We can live without it  
01:52 <+jvelociter> could be a standard withTip behavior  
01:52 <@sdumitriu> Just raising a flag  
01:52 <+jvelociter> yep  
01:52 <@sdumitriu> Your call  
01:52 <@sdumitriu> (I'm +1 for removing code in general)  
01:55 <+jvelociter> actually if we keep the old code we should make it not interfere with withTip  
01:55 <+jvelociter> otherwise both listeners will get called  
01:57 <@sdumitriu> I don't think compatibility.js is the solution  
01:57 <@sdumitriu> Since it will always be active  
01:57 <@sdumitriu> Better leave it out  
01:57 <@sdumitriu> No big loss  
01:58 <+jvelociter> yeah  
02:08 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: Up?  
02:08 <@sdumitriu> Probably not...  
02:08 <@sdumitriu> Time flies when you're having fun  
02:14 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: When will you have more time to code for the platform?  
02:15 <+jvelociter> as it goes, it's not for march  
02:15 <+jvelociter> I hope it will be April though  
02:15 <+jvelociter> can't wait to have more time for doing product dev  
03:32 <abusenius> has quit  
03:51 <DrLou> has quit  
06:01 <Denis1> has quit  
06:08 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <sdumitriu> has quit  
10:38 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <vmassol> jvelociter: good morning. So you were able to fix extensions.xwiki.org in the end?  
11:40 <vmassol> hmm build failure in rendering module  
11:40 <vmassol> Failed tests:  
11:40 <vmassol>   link/link3.test [xwiki/1.0, xwiki/2.0](org.xwiki.rendering.scaffolding.RenderingTestCase): null expected:<...nce>>reference]] [[\*[not bold]\*>>reference]]> but was:<...nce>>reference]] [[\*[\*not bold\*]\*>>reference]]>  
11:40 <vmassol> Tests run: 90, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0  
11:40 <vmassol> will look at it a bit later  
11:40 <vmassol> (if nobody beats me)  
11:47 <+jvelociter> vmassol: hi  
11:48 <+jvelociter> yes extensions.xwiki.org is fixed, I think for good ;)  
11:49 <+jvelociter> short story : for some reason guest had right to undelete on that wiki, my theory is that google bot ran over all documents in the trashbin  
11:49 <+jvelociter> (in my opinion it had the documents that got undeleted already indexed, that's why it "knew" their adress)  
11:50 <+jvelociter> anyway, I restored the backup just like last time + emptied the trashbin  
11:50 <+jvelociter> I think guest still has right to undelete, so we can investigate why  
11:51 <+jvelociter> (it's not the case on a standard distrib)  
12:18 <vmassol> jvelociter: ah ok, indeed could be an explanation  
12:18 <vmassol> thanks for fixing it!  
12:32 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki

17:18 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
18:07 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
20:15 <vmassol> got another build error in web/standard when compiling js  
20:15 <vmassol> org.mozilla.javascript.EvaluatorException: Compilation produced 24 syntax errors.  
20:15 <vmassol> jvelociter or sdumitriu: could one of you try it out?  
20:15 <vmassol> the problem is actually in searchSuggest.js  
20:16 <vmassol> so I guess jvelociter you're the best for fixing this… :)  
20:16 <vmassol> my guess is that it contains velocity  
20:16 <vmassol> an it's not been excluded  
20:16 <vmassol> (this also suggest (hehe) that the build wasn't tested locally :))  
20:17 <vmassol> 3 different build errors so far....  
20:17 <vmassol> fixed 2, remaining this one and I hope it'll build fine  
20:17 <vmassol> I just wanted to move xwiki-rendering but haven't been able to even start....  
21:24 <vmassol> sdumitriu: XE fails to start correctly  
21:24 <vmassol> 2011-02-26 21:24:01.685::WARN:  failed org.mortbay.jetty.webapp.WebAppContext@52c05d3b{/xwiki,/Users/vmassol/dev/xwiki/trunks-clean4/enterprise/distribution/jetty/hsqldb/target/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.0-SNAPSHOT/jetty/../webapps/xwiki}: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/xwiki/eventstream/EventStream  
21:24 <vmassol> 2011-02-26 21:24:02.227::WARN:  failed ContextHandlerCollection@f29df8a: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/xwiki/eventstream/EventStream  
21:24 <vmassol> 2011-02-26 21:24:02.233::INFO:  Opened /Users/vmassol/dev/xwiki/trunks-clean4/enterprise/distribution/jetty/hsqldb/target/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.0-SNAPSHOT/jetty/logs/2011\_02\_26.request.log  
21:24 <vmassol> 2011-02-26 21:24:02.234::WARN:  failed HandlerCollection@59a02097: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/xwiki/eventstream/EventStream  
21:24 <vmassol> 2011-02-26 21:24:02.234::WARN:  Error starting handlers  
21:24 <vmassol> java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/xwiki/eventstream/EventStream  
21:24 <vmassol> seems it's not included  
21:25 <vmassol> probably missing a dep  
21:25 <vmassol> in web/standard/pom.xml  
21:27 <vmassol> adding it  
21:43 <vmassol> ok done, build working and application starting!  
21:44 <vmassol> pfew :)  
22:22 <vmassol> has quit
